intro: Melampodium aureum, commonly known as golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and grows in a compact, upright form. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
